entry.title: Elk Island Drops Lawsuit Against City of Roseburg, Citing “Path Forward” and Grants Pass Shelter Focus
entry.summary: Elk Island Trading Group dismissed its lawsuit against the City of Roseburg, citing a possible path forward through changes to the Homeless Commission and a focus on Parker’s Place Village in Grants Pass, expected to open June 1, 2026.

entry.title: Community Invited to MLK Day of Service River Cleanup and Restoration in Roseburg
entry.summary: Roseburg residents are invited to volunteer Monday for the annual MLK Day of Service river cleanup and invasive species removal event. Crews will work in several city parks, with a 9 a.m. gathering at Stewart Park Pavilion.

entry.title: Roseburg High Students to Gain Hands-On Healthcare Training at UCC Through New Partnership
entry.summary: Roseburg High School students will soon train on the Umpqua Community College campus after both boards approved a new partnership. The agreement creates dedicated space in UCC’s Medical Careers Hub, opening new healthcare career pathways for local students.

entry.title: A healthier Douglas County: The past, present and future of Thrive Umpqua
entry.summary: In 2017, Blue Zones Project-Umpqua was formed to inspire healthier and more active living in a county struggling with maintaining healthy behavior among its residents.

entry.title: CDC Business Development Corporation hosts cybersecurity talk for small business owners
entry.summary: It is a small business owner's worst nightmare: a single click on an unfamiliar link in a text message or email and suddenly all of their private data is accessed, leaving all their had work vulnerable to collapse.

entry.title: Multi Jurisdictional Training Exercise Planned in Downtown Roseburg
entry.summary: A multi jurisdictional training exercise simulating a train car hazardous materials incident will take place in downtown Roseburg on February 10. Residents may see increased emergency activity. This is only a drill and there is no threat to the public.
